title: I thought assassins were supposed to be high risk/high reward??

Zed is the go to mid laner (as an assassin) because one by one, Riot is ripping the throat out of assassins, and he is the last one left standing.

The difference with Zed is that most other champions can perform their job without their ultimate. Go ahead, try and assassinate someon as a non-fed Zed without your ultimate. i DARE you. Because it isnt possible. Meanwhile, Fizz, Ahri, LB (20 cooldown, hourglass doesnt count that or Ahri's ult), Talon, all capable of killing without their ult (talon has the hardest time of those listed, but he doesnt get hard countered by hourglasses active, its a soft counter, unlike Zed).

The reason Hourglass countering Zed is a bigger deal than other champions is for a couple reasons: 1) you dont need to be quick or good with the active to avoid 2/3 of his burst. 2) It can stop his ult, and his entire combo because of the cast time on his ult. 

Now, compare that to Fizz, Ahri, LB, or Talon (or even Akali). Sure you could Hourglass something of their combo. But Talon does his so fast you would need almost beyond human reaction time to use it against a competent Talon. Ahri does 2/3 of her burst while your charmed and incapable of using the active, as well as being able to save her second and third ult charge for when hourglass ends, meaning you only negate 1/3 of her ult. LBs ult is on a 20 second cooldown, so hourglass is useless against her in terms of avoiding damage.

Plenty of assassins are safe.  The ones that aren't tend to be champions with mind bogglingly good ults and snowballing power like {{champion:84}} and {{champion:38}}.

If you just open up the champion menu and type "assassin", you'll see a ton of champions that are safe in lane.  Assassins are inherently mobile champions, which is good for safety, and they tend to be both slippery and strong in 1v1 situations.  Those are just the basic characteristics of the class, and they lend well towards being safe compared to say mages or marksmen.

Its not just about safety.. its about a dominant lane phase/pushing power + safety.

How many of those assassins can wave clear with safety?

> Its not just about safety.. its about a dominant lane phase/pushing power + safety.
> 
> How many of those assassins can wave clear with safety?

Quite a few assassins wave clear safely.  Off the top of my head: {{champion:103}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:238}} 

In general, assassins follow one of two play patterns:
A. Good at killing opposing laner.  Someone like {{champion:84}} whose basic plan is to kill the opposing laner over and over.
B. Good at roaming.  Someone like {{champion:103}} who really enjoys showing up unexpected and collecting double kills in the bot lane.

Plan B requires good wave clear, so it's no surprise that assassins often have effective wave clear against opposing pushers.

Talon's rake is among the best waveclear spells in the game.  Usually it's possible to tag an opponent attempting to deny you waveclear with the rake, making counterattack difficult to impossible depending on opponent.

> Ahri is more of a mage than an assassin.

Ahri was one of the big 4 assassins in the Ahri/Fizz/Zed/Kassadin season 3 meta and her rework soundly defeated the idea of playing her as a kitey mage.  Now she's clearly about diving with R, charming, and landing a DFG combo to kill.  Many former mage Ahri players are still salty about it.

In any case, great waveclear leading to assassin style roaming is Ahri's thing.

> Leblanc received a huge nerf for being so dominant.

So did Talon.  Doesn't change the fact that her rework led her to max W first for easy and safe waveclear.  If anything, her nerf only emphasized the push and roam plan.

Look, if Zed is the only reason you are losing fights then nullify him in a fight with peel and focus. If you cannot peel a Zed then don't blame the champion, look for ways to counter the champion rather than shout about how you can't do anything against him on the forums. Don't be lazy, get out of the habit of always play X way and you will win. Look to counter your enemy and win based on the current match, not a pre-game schematic in your head.
